content:
Yes, there are certainly many amazing contemporary Irish musicians who incorporate the harp into their music, and I'm glad to hear you're excited to check them out! Here are a few album and song recommendations to get you started:

1. Moya Brennan - "Two Horizons" - This album features a blend of classic Celtic instrumentation and modern electronic elements, all anchored by Brennan's beautiful harp playing. Check out the title track, "Two Horizons," for an example of how she integrates the harp into her music.

2. Cormac De Barra - "Barcá" - This album showcases De Barra's unique approach to the harp, with a mixture of traditional and contemporary tracks. For a taste, check out "The Liberty Bell," which blends harp, guitar, and drums into a driving, upbeat tune.

3. Aine Minogue - "Eve" - This album features Minogue's haunting harp music, along with her ethereal vocals. Check out the track "Maiden of Mysteries," which combines the gentle strumming of the harp with Minogue's beautifully layered vocals.

4. Janet Harbison - "Pieces of Time" - This album features some of Harbison's original compositions, as well as traditional Irish music pieces. It demonstrates her expertise on the harp, and the ways she has blended it with contemporary classical music. Check out "Stella's Promise" for an example.

5. Grainne Hambly - "The Thorn Tree" - This album showcases Hambly's skill on the harp, as well as her original arrangements of traditional Irish music. Check out "The Blackbird" for an example of how she takes a well-known traditional tune and adds her own flair with intricate harp runs.

These are just a few examples, but I hope they give you a good starting point to explore these amazing harp players and their music!
